Class DataDisplayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.dragos.userdatamonitor.DataDisplaying.DataDisplayer

  • public class DataDisplayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will be responsible for the logic behind taking the hash map (with all the user data) and creating the formatted display sting that shows how many users there are etc Created by Dragos on 10/5/17.

      java.lang.String displayMonthlyStatistic(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> userData, java.lang.String selectedDate)
      Iterate over the HashMap to find the total number of users (listeners and Interpreters) who used the app on the same month and year of the currently selected date (from the calander)
      java.lang.String getDataDisplay(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> userData, java.lang.String selectedDate)
      Take in the hash map containing all the user data (loaded from the JSON data on the server) and a user selected date, and return a formatted string displaying the user data stats
